page.title: 13Chesfield park and church
page.content: ...As we entered{Chesfield Park}we were greeted by Rosie the labrador,and her puppy.New trees have been planted in the woodland round the edge of the estate and in fields,one replacing a tree struck by lightning.The young ones have wire around them for protection from grazing creatures like the horses and cattle whose owners rent the fields here.There were old tyres resting against the fence for horse jumps.The bullocks followed us and many flies followed them.We saw the house,but not close to. We walked through{Manor Farm},a riding school for the disabled,and we saw the ruins of{Chesfield Church}.It was built in 1280,you can see the shape it was and where the walls were.They were two feet four inches thick.No-one knows why{Chesfield {village}disappeared.
